intro: Hanceola yuanyangensis, commonly known as the Yuanyangensis Hancea, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. The plant is known for its delicate appearance and is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or rocky areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a threatened species. Its botanical features make it an important subject for conservation and botanical research.
